hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Fade for High-Beta Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a sharp, news-driven price spike (>8% in 2 hours) for a high-beta approved altcoin (e.g., PEPE, DOGE, SKY) during a NEUTRAL regime, a short position entered after momentum stalls will capture a mean-reverting move of at least 50% retracement of the initial spike over the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral markets, liquidity is often insufficient to sustain news-driven pumps in speculative assets. The initial surge exhausts immediate buyers, leading to profit-taking and selling from those who missed the entry, creating a predictable fade opportunity.
entry_conditions: Approved high-beta altcoin price increases >8% within a 2-hour window on identifiable news
Momentum stalls: The first 1-hour candle after the spike closes in its bottom 25% range (showing upper wick/selling pressure)
Enter short on the open of the next 1-hour candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2-hour spike (measured from pre-spike open to spike high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks above the high of the initial 2-hour spike candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median retracement after a valid entry is less than 30% of the initial spike, or the stop-loss is hit more than 35% of the time in a sample of 30+ events.
